p: Quercetin and its glycosylated analogs, especially those substituted at C-3 and C-7 positions and those with an additional hydroxyl group in A ring, are considered as potent antiretroviral agents. Indeed, herbacitrin and quercetin had strong antiviral activities against human immunodeficiency virus type 1 (HIV-1) ( Áy et al., 2019). Quercetin had potent antiviral activities towards a wide range of viruses such as Human Herpesviruses ( Kim et al., 2020), the dengue virus type-2 and hepatitis C virus ( Batiha et al., 2020). Isoquercitrin (quercetin-3- O-glucoside) displayed a potent antiviral activity against varicella-zoster virus (VZV), human cytomegalovirus (HCMV) ( Kim et al., 2020), ebola ( Qiu et al., 2016) and influenza viruses ( Kim et al., 2010). According to the study of Dayem et al. (2015) isorhamnetin had stronger antiviral effect compared to quercetin and kaempferol due to the presence of a supplementary methyl group on C-3′ position in B ring.
